buildTools.name: Webpack
buildTools.description: A static module bundler for JavaScript applications that processes and transforms various resources into a dependency graph, allowing you to use and import modules.

buildTools.name: Babel
buildTools.description: A JavaScript compiler that allows developers to use next-generation JavaScript features by transforming modern code into backward-compatible versions.

buildTools.name: Gulp
buildTools.description: A toolkit to automate painful or time-consuming tasks in your development workflow through streaming builds that are efficient and code-over-configuration focused.

buildTools.name: ESLint
buildTools.description: A static code analysis tool for identifying problematic patterns in JavaScript code, ensuring code consistency and avoiding bugs.

buildTools.name: Grunt
buildTools.description: A JavaScript task runner that automates repetitive tasks like minification, compilation, unit testing, and linting through configuration over code.

buildTools.name: Rollup
buildTools.description: A module bundler for JavaScript that compiles small pieces of code into something larger and more complex, optimizing for ES modules.

buildTools.name: Parcel
buildTools.description: A zero-configuration web application bundler that offers blazing fast performance and requires no configuration files.

buildTools.name: Prettier
buildTools.description: An opinionated code formatter that enforces a consistent style by parsing your code and re-printing it with its own rules.

buildTools.name: TypeScript
buildTools.description: A strongly typed programming language that builds on JavaScript, giving you better tooling at any scale.

buildTools.name: Vite
buildTools.description: A next-generation frontend build tool that significantly improves the frontend development experience with features like instant server start and hot module replacement.
